awd_titl_txt: System Analysis and Design under Space- and Time-Dependent Uncertainty
awd_abstract_narration:
Engineering systems are always subjected to uncertainty, which is due to the randomness in many places, such as the environment, material properties, manufacturing imprecision, and imperfect knowledge. No consideration or improper consideration of uncertainty (unknowns, surprises) during system design may result in low reliability, quality, and robustness; higher costs; and even catastrophe. This research accounts for the most common type of uncertainty that varies in space and with respect to time with the following two benefits. First, it allows engineers to better understand how the space- and time-dependent uncertainty impacts system performance. Second, it enables engineers to design systems with minimized effect of the space- and time-dependent uncertainty. As a result, the research results will add new knowledge to the current theories and methodologies of engineering and systems design, and also make products more reliable and safer. This research will be applicable to wide engineering applications, ranging from large civil systems to small integrated circuit systems. Other potential areas that will benefit include operations research, reliability engineering, statistics, and probability, where space-dependent and time-dependent probabilistic approaches play a vital role. The inclusion of research results into engineering courses and educational materials will better foster probabilistic thinking for engineering students, making them be more responsible for public safety and welfare.

The objective of this research is to quantify and reduce the effect of space- and time-dependent uncertainty on system performance. The major approach is the integration of system analysis and design methodologies with advanced theories of stochastic processes and random fields. The project first answers a question about how the space- and time-dependent uncertainty in the system input (design parameters) propagates to the system output (performance). This provides a better understanding of the effect of uncertainty and identifies complete probabilistic characteristics of system performance over space and time. Second, this research answers a question of how to optimally determine design variables so that the effect of the space- and time-dependent uncertainty is minimized with a lower cost and reduced risk. All engineering systems are required to work properly with stable performance in a desired space and period of time, and this project will produce new methodologies to achieve this requirement.

por.por_cntn:
Randomness or uncertainty exists in operations, design, and manufacturing of any products and engineering systems. Operation conditions (loading, temperature, etc.), material properties, and dimensions of parts are all random. As a result, the performance of the product or system will also be random, no matter how small it might be. For example, the efficiency and life of a vehicle are not constant; they vary randomly vehicle by vehicle. If the randomness in performance is high, it will lead to low reliability and possible loss of value and life. The aim of this project is to predict the randomness of the product performance, or the effect of uncertainty on the product performance, during the design stage. This project also performs design optimization to reduce the effect of uncertainty if it is high. This project deals with the general uncertainty or randomness that varies over time and in space. This kind of uncertainty makes products behave differently at different times and in diffidently locations.

The first group of methodologies from this project are those for reliability prediction. Reliability is measured by the probability (chance) that a product or system can function properly without failure. Reliability is an important indicator of uncertainty effect. High reliability means proper functionality even under a high degree of uncertainty. The methodologies help engineers answer important questions: What is the chance that a product can still work after it has been working for a period of time? Why and how will an engineering system behave randomly? How much is the degree of randomness? The answers enable engineers understand if the reliability requirement is satisfied for a given design. If they change design variables, they can obtain a new reliability prediction. This enables the fast what-if analysis for reliability and can eliminate the need of lengthy and costly physical reliability testing. The second group of methodologies from this project are those for design for reliability. Engineers use the methodologies to perform optimization design. The optimal design minimizes the cost and at the same time achieves the required reliability. The design methodologies can be used for a new design or an existing design whose reliability needs to be improved. The methodologies design high reliability into products efficiently.

Although the applications of the project are targeted to Mechanical Engineering, the research results can also impact reliability engineering. Reliability engineering methodologies depend primarily on data and statistical models. This project adds physics-based reliability models, design methodologies, and associated numerical algorithms to reliability engineering. It can also help integrating physics-based reliability methodologies with statistics-based reliability methodologies. Many research results have been modified and introduced into two graduate courses and one undergraduate course. The teaching materials enhance student learning about uncertainty and the ability to use probabilistic and statistic methods in solving engineering problems. The results can better foster probabilistic thinking for engineering students, making them to be more responsible for public safety and welfare. Modern society is less tolerant of failures that may result in loss of value or life due to poor reliability. Accurate reliability prediction and design enables engineers to make more reliable, safer, and inexpensive products, thereby not only increasing companies? competitiveness, but also improving quality of life.
